definition: (of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: A plot was uncovered against the President.
sentences.chinese: 謀害總統的陰謀敗露了。

sentences.english: The kidnapper is yulia tutor, see his jump off a building suicide.
sentences.chinese: 綁匪是尤麗亞的家教老師，見事情敗露便跳樓自盡。

sentences.english: Most who unveil hisagendas deserve the condemnation they receive。
sentences.chinese: 大多數人，祕密計劃敗露了，得到應有的譴責。

sentences.english: His plot has been struck out.
People guessed, people knew, and eventually it was only a matter of time before it all had to come out.
sentences.chinese: 人們的猜疑，窺探，到最後事情最終被敗露。

sentences.english: Most who unveil hisagendas deserve the condemnation they receive.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人，祕密計劃敗露了，應譴責。

sentences.english: What do by night appear by day.
sentences.chinese: 夜間乾的事，白天會敗露。

sentences.english: Suppose you were exposed in the opposite position by your opponent, .
sentences.chinese: 假設你被敵手敗露在相背的位置，。

sentences.english: Brought to light the inner distress still not calm, can not mature sophistication.
sentences.chinese: 遇事還是會敗露內心的不平靜，做不到成熟老辣。

sentences.english: The conspiracy did not come to light until a newspaper reporter noticed.
sentences.chinese: 直到報社的記者發現，這個陰謀才敗露出來。

sentences.english: At last Alberta Fujimore knew that the game was up, and let him be taken by the police.
sentences.chinese: 最後藤森知道罪行已敗露，讓警察把他帶走了。

definition: lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to hang oneself
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to frame sb/to accuse falsely
shameful secret
prison/jail
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to behead
to give sb a demerit
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
